channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: FTX warns it will claw back political donations and contributions
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The exchange warned those who received payments from FTX or its former executives that it's looking to recover funds even if they were donated to charity.

item.title: Vitalik Buterin reveals 3 ‘huge’ opportunities for crypto in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: There's still plenty of room for innovation, according to Ethereum's co-founder Vitalik Buterin.

item.title: 'Huge signal and validation' — Top Activision exec to take Yuga Labs' helm
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Stephen Katte
item.description: Kieran Warwick, co-founder of blockchain role-playing game Illuvium believes Yuga Labs latest hire will be a boon for GameFi.

item.title: $1.7M in Bitcoin tied to QuadrigaCX reawakens after years of dormancy
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The wallets were thought to be inaccessible following the death of the exchange's founder in 2018, as he had sole responsibility for the wallet's private keys.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried agrees to US extradition 'to put the customers right': Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: The former FTX CEO attended an emergency hearing of the Bahamas Magistrate Court just hours earlier, returning to prison following the event.

item.title: Bank of Canada emphasizes need for stablecoin regulation as legislation is tabled
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: A note by central bank researchers says regulation is the key to reaping the benefits of fiat-referenced crypto assets after the Canadian parliament fails to consider legislation.

item.title: $16K retest the most likely path for Bitcoin, according to 2 derivative metrics
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: Top traders' long-to-short ratio and stronger demand for stablecoins in Asia indicate higher odds of further price correction.

item.title: Successful decentralization doesn't need blockchains — Nillion CEO
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: According to the CEO of Nillion, “decentralization is a spectrum with multiple axes.”

item.title: Crypto’s regulatory fate will be decided in the year ahead
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Kadan Stadelmann
item.description: Congress is set to take up a slew of legislative proposals in 2023 that will determine which regulators have chief domain over cryptocurrency.

item.title: Next House committee chair reintroduces bill on crypto innovation
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Under the bill, companies could apply for an “enforceable compliance agreement” with offices at federal financial agencies that would allow for a regulatory path forward.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried arrested and consented to the extradition — Law Decoded, Dec. 12-19.
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: The entrepreneur reportedly reconsidered his earlier decision to contest extradition and now would be able to appear in a United States court.

item.title: Boris Johnson’s brother steps down as Binance adviser amid concerns over the exchange: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: Lord Johnson of Marylebone reportedly took up a role on the U.K. advisory board of one of Binance’s subsidiaries in September.

item.title: Binance increases stake in Tokocrypto after initial investment in 2020
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: This is the third licensed Asian cryptocurrency exchange Binance has upped its stake in as it expands its global reach; the company had shown signs of struggling.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried wants to see indictment before extradition to US: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Authorities in the Bahamas have had the former FTX CEO in custody since Dec. 12, shortly before he was denied bail.

item.title: BTC price faces 20% drop in weeks if Bitcoin avoids key level — Analyst
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin does not look good when it comes to sustained BTC price upside, traders warn, as GBTC reaches a fresh record discount.

item.title: Grayscale CEO highlights 20% GBTC share buyback option if ETF conversion fails
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The proposed offer would require both SEC relief and shareholders’ approval.

item.title: What is the relationship between blockchain and Web3?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jagjit Singh
item.description: Amidst the Web3 revolution, the importance of blockchain in Web3 lies in offering a universal state layer to build the decentralized Web.

item.title: Axelar launches $60M startup ecosystem program
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The program aims to accelerate the development of decentralized applications and protocols to replace centralized exchanges.

item.title: Crypto investment firm CoinShares debuts trading on Nasdaq Stockholm
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: CoinShares’ stock was previously listed on the Nasdaq First North Growth Market, an alternative stock exchange for small and medium-sized companies.

item.title: Binance.US set to acquire Voyager Digital assets for $1B
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Previously, FTX US was the largest bidder for the firm’s assets, with an offer of $1.4 billion.

item.title: Eva Kaili arrest a ‘setback’ for EU crypto regulations, economist says
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: European Parliamentarian Eva Kaili’s arrest under allegations of corruption is being labeled as a blow to crypto and blockchain adoption.

item.title: How will ChatGPT affect the Web3 space? Industry answers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: From smart contract auditing to enhancing user interactions, executives point out how ChatGPT can potentially affect Web3.

item.title: What is crypto market capitulation and its significance
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Cryptocurrency market capitulation revolves around investors' fears of further losses in a seemingly never-ending downward spiral, but it's also the period of maximum opportunity.

item.title: 'Wave lower' for all markets? 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: BTC price hovers in a tight range, but Bitcoin analysts are predicting a grim end to the year for risk asset holders.

item.title: Ethereum bulls wake up after four years to transfer 22,982 ETH
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: The ETH tokens in question originated from trading platforms Genesis and Poloniex and were found transferring 13,103.99 ETH and 9,878 ETH, respectively.

item.title: Nifty News: Building bridges in the metaverse, elaborate Apes scam and more
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Stephen Katte
item.description: A South Korean province is using the metaverse for closer economic ties with Vietnam and an elaborate phishing scam netted 14 Bored Apes.

item.title: Nigeria set to pass bill recognizing Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.category: House of Representatives Committee on Capital Markets
item.description: The slated law comes as Nigeria's eNaira has only managed to obtain a 0.5% adoption rate, a little more than a year after its launch in October 2021.

item.title: $4B OneCoin scam co-founder pleads guilty, faces 60 years jail
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The co-founder of the fraudulent scheme is set to be sentenced in April 2023 on charges relating to wire fraud and money laundering.

item.title: Israeli court rules authorities can seize crypto in 150 blacklisted wallets
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Stephen Katte
item.description: Over 150 crypto wallets blacklisted for alleged links to the funding of terror groups can now be drained of all funds following a ruling by an Israeli court.

item.title: US Senate banking chair floats possibility of banning crypto
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brayden Lindrea
item.description: Despite suggesting a possible ban, U.S. Senator Sherrod Brown stated it would be “very difficult” to do so because activity “would go offshore.”
